v.v: Then Zophar the Naamathite answered and said,
“My thoughts make me answer quickly
I hear a rebuke that dishonors me,
Do you not know this fact from ancient times,
the triumph of a wicked man is short,
Though his height reaches up to the heavens,
yet such a person will perish permanently like his own feces;
He will fly away like a dream and will not be found;
The eye that saw him will see him no more;
His children will apologize to poor people;
His bones are full of youthful strength,
Although wickedness is sweet in his mouth,
although he holds it there and does not let it go
the food in his intestines turns bitter;
He swallows down riches, but he will vomit them up again;
He will suck the poison of asps;
He will not enjoy the streams,
He will give back the fruit of his labor and will not be able to eat it;
For he has oppressed and neglected poor people;
Because he has known no satisfaction himself,
There is nothing left that he did not devour;
In the abundance of his wealth he will fall into trouble;
When he is about to fill his stomach, God will throw the fierceness of his wrath on him;
Although that man will flee from the iron weapon,
He pulls it out of his back
Complete darkness is reserved for his treasures;
The heavens will reveal his iniquity,
The wealth of his house will vanish;
This is the wicked man’s portion from God,

v: because of the worry that is in me.
but a spirit from my understanding answers me.
when God placed man on earth:
and the joy of a godless man lasts only for a moment?
and his head reaches to the clouds,
those who have seen him will say, ‘Where is he?’
indeed, he will be chased away like a vision of the night.
his place will see him no longer.
his hands will have to give back his wealth.
but it will lie down with him in the dust.
although he hides it under his tongue,
but keeps it still in his mouth—
it becomes the poison of asps inside him.
God will cast them out of his stomach.
the viper’s tongue will kill him.
the torrents of honey and butter.
he will not enjoy the wealth earned by his commerce.
he has violently taken away houses that he did not build.
he will not be able to save anything in which he takes pleasure.
therefore his prosperity will not be permanent.
the hand of everyone who is in poverty will come against him.
God will rain it down on him while he is eating.
a bow of bronze will shoot him.
and the gleaming point comes out of his liver.
Terrors come over him.
a fire not fanned will devour him;
it will consume what is left in his tent.
and the earth will rise up against him as a witness.
his goods will flow away on the day of God’s wrath.
the heritage reserved for him by God.”
